creditline: Gift of Jeffrey Lee in honor of Dennis Michael Jon
description: folded sheet of paper, with the title "FREE MAN'S DUTIES" and text on back side; colorful image on the front with a soldier wearing a blue helmet and brown shirt, holding a gun in profile; blue background
inscription: on inner left side of folded sheet; in LLC, in pencil: HG-65 (13)
portfolio: From Century of the Common Man portfolio
provenance: Jeffrey Lee, New York; given to MIA, 2018.
signed: LRC in margin, in black ink: HUGO GELLERT
text: Hugo Gellert was one of America’s leading political artists of the first half of the 1900s. He dedicated his art to the advancement of socialist ideals. In 1943, in the depths of World War II, he produced a portfolio of nineteen screenprints entitled “Century of the Common Man,” which served as a visual manifesto of his values. Each plate was devoted to one or two basic ideas; here, the need to fight to preserve freedom.
title: Free Man's Duties 3
